page.title: 05Whissonsett Primary School
page.content:
Whissonsett School was built in 1868, it's quite small with only 34 pupils, they have two classrooms each about the same size. The school has four exits one out of each cloakroom, one from the kitchen, and one from the assembly hall. The school also has a small library in one corner of the assembly hall. The school has a P.E shed and lots of gym equipment. A big field is used to play netball and football and in the summer they play rounders. The school has a staff of two teachers. The kitchen is quite big with a cooker, but they don't cook their own meals, they get them from Weasenham School.
{CONTINUE ON PAGE 6
